Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below, with two bands in added red; exterior: dot and billet pattern at rim above maeander band running left; below, band of zigzags; below, painted decoration consisting of bull (ear, part of neck and part of horn remaining) to right; dot rosette, pendant roundel and rosette with double outline above as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the simple interior decoration.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, no. 217, pl. 17)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 81, no. 2, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0251) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
